keyMoments.title: Luffy Confronts Enel
keyMoments.description: Luffy finally comes face-to-face with Enel and immediately challenges the self-proclaimed god, questioning what makes him worthy of being called a god.
keyMoments.significance: The beginning of the climactic battle that will determine Skypiea's fate and showcase Luffy's natural advantage against a seemingly invincible opponent.
keyMoments.quote: So you're the god everyone's talking about? What makes you a god anyway?

keyMoments.title: Luffy Survives El Thor Attack
keyMoments.description: Luffy survives Enel's devastating El Thor lightning attack completely unharmed, shocking both Enel and Nami. Luffy himself seems confused about the attack.
keyMoments.significance: First demonstration that Luffy has a natural defense against Enel's lightning powers, beginning to undermine Enel's confidence.
keyMoments.quote: Huh? What was that supposed to be?

keyMoments.title: Luffy's Lightning Immunity Explained
keyMoments.description: After surviving three consecutive lightning attacks (El Thor, 60 Million Volt Jamboule, and 100 Million Volt Vari), it's revealed that Luffy's rubber body makes him completely immune to electrical attacks.
keyMoments.significance: This revelation is the turning point of the Skypiea arc, establishing why Luffy can defeat a Logia user without Haki through natural Devil Fruit matchups.

keyMoments.title: Luffy Can Touch and Hurt Enel
keyMoments.description: Luffy demonstrates that his rubber body allows him to physically touch and harm Enel despite him being a Logia user, giving him a complete advantage in the fight.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes that Luffy has found a way to harm a Logia user without Haki through natural Devil Fruit properties, a crucial concept for understanding power matchups.
keyMoments.quote: I don't know about god powers or whatever, but I can hit you just fine!

reveals.information: Luffy's rubber body is completely immune to electrical attacks, making him Enel's natural enemy
Luffy can physically touch and harm Enel despite him being a Logia user due to rubber's insulating properties

keyMoments.title: Birka's Destruction Revealed
keyMoments.description: McKinley reveals that Enel destroyed his home island of Birka six years ago before coming to Skypiea, confirming him as someone who has committed genocide before.
keyMoments.significance: This revelation establishes Enel's backstory and confirms the extent of his destructive nature, showing he has already annihilated an entire civilization.

keyMoments.title: Battle Against Luffy Begins
keyMoments.description: Enel begins his battle against Luffy, confident in his divine power and expecting an easy victory over the pirate.
keyMoments.significance: The start of the battle that will ultimately reveal Enel's vulnerability and shatter his god complex.

keyMoments.title: Enel's God Complex Shattered
keyMoments.description: For the first time, Enel's absolute confidence in his divine status is shaken as he faces an opponent immune to his most powerful attacks, showing genuine fear and disbelief.
keyMoments.significance: This moment deconstructs the god mythology Enel built around himself, showing his power is not absolute and he can be challenged and defeated.
keyMoments.quote: Impossible... How can this be? I am God!

abilities.description: Enel releases a massive spherical lightning attack that engulfs his target in electrical energy.
A devastating point-blank electrical discharge, one of Enel's most powerful attacks.

reveals.information: Enel destroyed his home island of Birka six years ago before coming to Skypiea
Enel's lightning attacks are completely ineffective against rubber, making Luffy his natural enemy

keyMoments.title: Realizes Luffy's Lightning Immunity
keyMoments.description: After witnessing Luffy survive three consecutive lightning attacks, Nami realizes and explains that Luffy's rubber body makes him completely immune to electrical attacks due to rubber being a natural insulator.
keyMoments.significance: Nami serves as the audience surrogate, providing the scientific explanation for why Luffy can withstand Enel's attacks and establishing the concept of natural Devil Fruit matchups.
keyMoments.quote: That's it! Luffy's body is made of rubber! Rubber doesn't conduct electricity! Enel's lightning attacks are completely useless against him!

keyMoments.title: Warns Angel Island Citizens
keyMoments.description: Conis arrives at Angel Island and courageously warns the citizens about Enel's plan to destroy the island, urging everyone to evacuate immediately despite the danger of defying the self-proclaimed god.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Conis's character growth from fearful citizen to brave protector of her people, showing her willingness to risk everything to save others from Enel's wrath.
keyMoments.quote: Everyone, please listen! You must evacuate the island immediately! Enel plans to destroy everything!

keyMoments.title: Reveals Birka's Destruction
keyMoments.description: McKinley reveals that Enel destroyed his home island of Birka, a sky island to the southeast, six years ago. This confirms Enel's true nature as a destructive tyrant who has committed genocide before.
keyMoments.significance: First mention of Birka's destruction, establishing Enel's backstory and the precedent for what could happen to Skypiea, dramatically raising the stakes.
keyMoments.quote: I can't let this island turn into another Birka. That sky island to the southeast disappeared six years ago... Enel destroyed his own homeland before coming here.

keyMoments.title: Guides Luffy to Enel
keyMoments.description: Using her Mantra (Observation Haki) ability, Aisa successfully guides Luffy through the complex interior of the Giant Jack to find Enel's location.
keyMoments.significance: Aisa's guidance is crucial in bringing together the two main combatants. Her Mantra ability proves instrumental in navigating the massive structure and setting up the climactic confrontation.
